comments.body: This test gives me a bit of pause. Would like other people to weigh in.
Can you elaborate on any concerns? I'd be happy to adjust

I believe this is correctly testing, it uses side-effects though so I would love if there was a way to make the behavior clear without this. Its still early morning so perhaps after a cup of coffee I'll have a better idea, but that's why I was hoping someone else might have an idea.

This is hard to test because you need to establish the following happens-before relationships: `F1.reads` -> `F2.reads` -> `F2.writes` -> `F1.writes`. 
Since `F1.reads` and `F1.writes` are inside `tryUpdate`, and `tryUpdate` takes an `A => A` (with no `F[_]` in sight), you do need side effects here.
It might be nice to follow this up with making this an Abstract class so and publishing it so users who implement Ref can test their implementations.
